thread.title: Bautista's homer lit up Twitterverse Jays | Sports | Toronto Sun
thread.title_full: Bautista's homer lit up Twitterverse | Blue Jays | Sports | Toronto Sun

author: torontosun.com
title: Bautista's homer lit up Twitterverse Jays | Sports | Toronto Sun
text:
TORONTO - It probably comes as no surprise that Jose Bautista was the most mentioned Blue Jays player on Twitter during the big game Wednesday.
Bautista’s game-winning homer and controversial bat flip were hot topics during Game 5 of the ALDS. He was mentioned in more than 180,000 tweets before the game wrapped. That’s almost five times more mentions than Edwin Encarnacion, the next-most-popular player in the Twitterverse during the game.
“There was a huge spike in tweets when Bautista hit his home run and the traffic on Twitter stayed strong for the rest of the game,” Twitter Canada’s Christopher Doyle said. “The final pitch was easily the most tweeted moment of the series, which helped the Jays’ #ComeTogether hashtag become the top trending hashtag globally for the evening.”
The team’s #ComeTogether motto was trending No. 1 in 39 different countries around the world after their sensational win.
JAYS vs. RANGERS - GAME 5
Tweet Volumes
420,000+ #BlueJays OR @BlueJays OR Jays OR #ComeTogether 230,000+ #ComeTogether mentions 14,000+/minute final pitch 9,300+/minute Bautiista home run Most mentioned players
180,000+ Jose Bautista (@JoeyBats19) 31,000+ Edwin Encarnacion (@Encadwin) 13,000+ Marcus Stroman (@MStrooo6) 12,000+ Kevin Pillar (@KPILLAR4)
Bautista's homer lit up Twitterverse
By Irene Thomaidis , Toronto Sun First posted: Thursday, October 15, 2015 08:43 PM EDT | Updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015 08:48 PM EDT
It probably comes as no surprise that Jose Bautista was the most mentioned Blue Jays player on Twitter during the big game Wednesday.
Bautista’s game-winning homer and controversial bat flip were hot topics during Game 5 of the ALDS. He was mentioned in more than 180,000 tweets before the game wrapped. That’s almost five times more mentions than Edwin Encarnacion, the next-most-popular player in the Twitterverse during the game.
“There was a huge spike in tweets when Bautista hit his home run and the traffic on Twitter stayed strong for the rest of the game,” Twitter Canada’s Christopher Doyle said. “The final pitch was easily the most tweeted moment of the series, which helped the Jays’ #ComeTogether hashtag become the top trending hashtag globally for the evening.”
The team’s #ComeTogether motto was trending No. 1 in 39 different countries around the world after the team’s sensational win.
